faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions about Passport OCR

items.question: Is it safe to upload an image of my passport?
items.answer: We take your security and privacy extremely seriously. Your image is uploaded via an encrypted connection, processed in memory, and then permanently deleted from our servers immediately after extraction. No data is ever stored.

items.question: What is a Passport MRZ?
items.answer: The MRZ, or Machine-Readable Zone, is the two-line code at the bottom of the passport's identity page. It contains the holder's personal information in a standardized format that can be read quickly by computers, which is what our tool scans.

items.question: What information is actually extracted from the passport?
items.answer: The tool extracts all the data encoded in the MRZ, which typically includes your full name, passport number, nationality, date of birth, sex, and the passport's expiry date.

items.question: Why did my passport scan fail?
items.answer: The most common reasons for a failed scan are poor image quality. Ensure your photo is clear, well-lit, and not blurry. Avoid glare on the MRZ, and make sure no fingers are covering the two lines of code.

items.question: Can you read visa stamps or other text on the passport?
items.answer: No. This tool is highly specialized to only read the MRZ. This focus is what allows it to be so fast and accurate for its specific purpose.

items.question: Is this service truly free?
items.answer: Yes, our online passport OCR tool is 100% free for individual use. For businesses that need to process a high volume of passports, we will be offering a Pro plan with API access in the near future.

items.question: What happens to my uploaded passport image?
items.answer: It is permanently deleted. We have a strict ephemeral processing policy: your file exists on our server only for the few seconds it takes to process it, and then it is irretrievably erased.

items.question: Can I use this for my business's KYC process?
items.answer: While this free tool is great for demonstration, for commercial use we strongly recommend signing up for our upcoming API waitlist. An API provides a more secure and seamless integration into your business application.
